ACT
111
Rights of the transferor's spouse
The transferor can include his spouse in the transfer and distribution, and then it is necessary that he agrees to this.
If the spouse is not covered, his right to the necessary share remains intact.
If the spouse is not included, the assignment and distribution are not invalid because of that, but when determining the value of the estate in order to determine the value of the necessary part of the surviving spouse, what the testator assigned and distributed to his descendants is considered a gift.
